channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How to watch Friday’s streaming-exclusive NFL game live online for free—and without cable
item.description: This season's Taylor Swift-watch gets underway.

item.title: Paramount’s new CEO tells employees to return to office full-time or quit ahead of layoffs
item.description: Employees who don’t want to comply have until mid-September to take a buyout.

item.title: An Indiana lawyer named Mark Zuckerberg is suing Meta, saying his Facebook pages keep getting disabled because he was ‘impersonating a celebrity’
item.description: Despite Zuckerberg being locked out of his account for months at a time, Meta kept the $11,000 the lawyer spent on advertising for his firm, according...

item.title: Is the Fed ready to go big? Analysts debate jumbo rate cut after soft jobs data
item.description: A half-point cut is “now in play,” some analysts say.

item.title: Summer lovin’, put on blast: Can CEOs stop behaving badly?
item.description: Is it that CEOs are behaving more poorly or just that we just have greater means to catch them in the act?

item.title: U.S. stocks lose ground Friday after anemic employment-growth data
S&P 500 component changes are expected after the closing bell
The U.S. economy had added jobs every month since 2020. Till this summer.
Stocks turn lower — and bond yields, dollar tumble — as jobs data jolt investors
Bond yields tumble as job-market frailty puts half-point Fed rate cut on table
